The John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: Alvin A. Achenbaum papers 1948-2011 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Market researcher and advertising executive who worked at several agencies; partner in a consulting practice under several names; lecturer and author of marketing textbooks.

The Alvin A. Achenbaum Papers span the years 1948-2011 and document Achenbaum's career in advertising (with Grey Advertising, J. Walter Thompson and Backer Spielvogel Bates agencies) and marketing consulting (as a partner in Alvin Achenbaum Associates, Canter Achenbaum Heekin, and Achenbaum Bogda Associates). Collection includes writings and speeches, correspondence, photographs, research reports and related materials. Clients represented include 7-Eleven, American Red Cross, AT&T, Block Drug, Bristol-Myers, Campbell Soup, Chrysler, Dairy Queen, Dentsu, Franklin Mint, General Foods, GTE, Hallmark, Honda, Integrity Music, Kayser-Roth, Kia, K-Mart, Miller Brewing, MTA, Nationwide, Nestlé, Nissan/Datsun, PCA, Pfizer, Philip Morris, Quaker Oats, Revlon, Ryerson Tull, Seagram, Toyota, U.S. Dept. of Defense, and Warner-Lambert. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
In addition, original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Research Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alvin Achenbaum Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Alvin Achenbaum Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2012.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Richard Collier, Cambridge Van Wagoner, May 2013
Accession 2012-0177 is described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

chronitem.event: McCann-Erickson Agency: Manager of Market Research; Economist and Market Analyst
Grey Advertising: Director of Marketing and Research; Vice President and Director of Marketing Services; Executive Vice President
Independent Research Company: interviewer and coder
Instructor, Bernard Baruch Graduate School of Public and Business Administration
Instructor, Advanced Advertising Institute at New York University Graduate School of Business
J. Walter Thompson Company: Executive Vice President and Director of Marketing Services and Corporate Planning
Canter, Achenbaum, Associates: Chairman of the Board
M/A/R/C Group: Outside Member of the Board
Backer Spielvogel Bates: Vice Chairman; Member of the Board
Achenbaum Bogda Associates: Chairman of the Board
Achenbaum Institute of Marketing: President and Chief Executive Officer

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Alvin A. Achenbaum Papers span the years 1948-2011 and document Achenbaum's career in advertising (with Grey Advertising, J. Walter Thompson and Backer Spielvogel Bates agencies) and marketing consulting (as a partner in Alvin Achenbaum Associates, Canter Achenbaum Heekin, and Achenbaum Bogda Associates). Collection includes writings and speeches, correspondence, photographs, research reports and related materials. Clients represented include 7-Eleven, American Red Cross, AT&T, Block Drug, Bristol-Myers, Campbell Soup, Chrysler, Dairy Queen, Dentsu, Franklin Mint, General Foods, GTE, Hallmark, Honda, Integrity Music, Kayser-Roth, Kia, K-Mart, Miller Brewing, MTA, Nationwide, Nestlé, Nissan/Datsun, PCA, Pfizer, Philip Morris, Quaker Oats, Revlon, Ryerson Tull, Seagram, Toyota, U.S. Dept. of Defense, and Warner-Lambert.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized into eleven series: General Files; Achenbaum Associates; Achenbaum Bogda Associates; Achenbaum Institute of Marketing; Achenbaum Marketing Communications; Backer Spielvogel Bates; Canter Achenbaum; Grey Advertising; J. Walter Thompson Company; Large Format Materials; and Writings and Speeches. Original folder titles have been maintained where possible.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
